video.title: TEDTalks: Rad Invention
video.synopsis: Present-day Da Vincis share their radical innovations, from a thought-controlled computer to a lab that grows human organs.

episodes.synopsis: Pranav Mistry demos tools that help the physical world interact with the world of data with open-sourced software.
episodes.title: Pranav Mistry: The Thrilling Potential of SixthSense Technology

episodes.synopsis: Plenty of robots can fly -- but none can fly like a real bird. That is, until Markus Fischer and his team built SmartBird.
episodes.title: Markus Fischer: A Robot That Flies Like a Bird

episodes.synopsis: Anthony Atala's lab grows human organs using some of its sci-fi gizmos, including a machine that "prints" human tissue.
episodes.title: Anthony Atala on Growing New Organs

episodes.synopsis: Rock-star physicist Brian Cox talks about the biggest of big science -- the Large Hadron Collider at CERN.
episodes.title: Brian Cox on CERN's Supercollider

episodes.synopsis: Engineer Michael Pritchard demos the portable Lifesaver filter, which can make the most revolting water drinkable in seconds.
episodes.title: Michael Pritchard's Filter Turns Filthy Water Drinkable

episodes.synopsis: Gary Wolf introduces an intriguing new pastime using mobile apps and always-on gadgets in gloriously geeky detail.
episodes.title: Gary Wolf: The Quantified Self

episodes.synopsis: Tan Le demos a computer that allows users to control virtual objects with mere thoughts (and a little concentration).
episodes.title: Tan Le: A Headset That Reads Your Brainwaves

episodes.synopsis: Introducing robotic add-ons that allow you to carry 200 pounds without tiring, or allows a wheelchair user to stand and walk.
episodes.title: Eythor Bender Demos Human Exoskeletons

episodes.synopsis: Using still photos culled from the Web, Photosynth can build breathtaking dreamscapes and let us navigate them.
episodes.title: Blaise Agüera y Arcas Demos Photosynth

episodes.synopsis: Brian Cox shares what's new with the CERN supercollider, and what the future holds for the largest science experiment.
episodes.title: Brian Cox: What Went Wrong at the LHC

episodes.synopsis: Regina Dugan, director of the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency, describes some of the extraordinary projects her agency has created.
episodes.title: Regina Dugan: From Mach-20 Glider to Hummingbird Drone

episodes.synopsis: Onstage at TED2012, Jack Choi demonstrates his 3D human body imaging device, which allows surgeons to explore the body's parts and systems virtually.
episodes.title: Jack Choi: On the Virtual Dissection Table

episodes.synopsis: After a crisis, how can we tell if water is safe to drink? TED Fellow Sonaar Luthra has designed a simple tool that quickly tests water for safety.
episodes.title: Sonaar Luthra: Meet the Water Canary

episodes.synopsis: Massimo Banzi helped invent the Arduino, a tiny open-source microcontroller that's inspired thousands to make the coolest things they can imagine.
episodes.title: Massimo Banzi: How Arduino Is Open-Sourcing Imagination

episodes.synopsis: How can a super-thin 3-inch disk levitate something 70,000 times its own weight? Boaz Almog demonstrates a phenomenon known as quantum locking.
episodes.title: Boaz Almog Levitates a Superconductor

episodes.synopsis: Matt Mills and Tamara Roukaerts demonstrate Aurasma, a new augmented reality tool that can seamlessly animate the world as seen through a smartphone.
episodes.title: Matt Mills: Image Recognition That Triggers Augmented Reality
